name: E. Sereja and Sets
statement:
Let’s assume that set consists of distinct intervals , , , (; are
integers).Let’s assume that is the maximum number of intervals that you
can choose from the set , such that every two of them do not intersect.
We assume that two intervals, and , intersect if there is an integer ,
which meets two inequalities: and .Sereja wonders, how many sets are
there, such that ? Count this number modulo .
